page.title: 11BRONZE AGE BARROW
page.content: At Carnon Downs we found a burial mound. It was a Bronze Age burial mound. By the mound was a plaque.The writing on it said 'This mound or round barrow is a tomb from the early to middle Bronze Age, from 1800 B.C.to 800 B.C.' It is protected under the Ancient Monuments Act ,and it is an offence to injure of deface it. The plaque was erected by the Ministry of Works. The circumference of the barrow is 52.2 metres and the diameter is 10.2 metres. An estate has been built around the mound and the road is named Parc-an- Creeg, which in Cornish means 'Field of the Barrow'. There is a second tumulus or burial mound about 300 metres west of the one a Parc-an-Creeg.
